commit_message:
Add resource-stickiness=INFINITY to VIPs

Right now we do not add any resource stickiness to the VIPs. This has
one consequence when we configure IHA: Namely, when a fenced compute
node comes back (i.e. it recovers), pacemaker is free to move the VIPs
around the controllers (see http://clusterlabs.org/pacemaker/doc/en-US/Pacemaker/1.1/html/Clusters_from_Scratch/_prevent_resources_from_moving_after_recovery.html)
to optimize the resource placement. We can observe the VIP moving with
the following message:
Apr 12 06:37:04 [979790] controller-1 pengine: notice: LogAction: * Move ip-10.0.0.110 ( controller-1 -> controller-0 )

This movement of the VIP is highly undesirable because in Instance HA the fence_compute agent needs to talk to keystone via the VIP, and if the VIP is on the move we might get the following errors:
Apr 12 06:37:23 [979787] controller-1 stonith-ng: warning: log_action: fence_compute[259311] stderr: [ Starting new HTTP connection (1): 10.0.0.110 ]
Apr 12 06:37:23 [979787] controller-1 stonith-ng: warning: log_action: fence_compute[259311] stderr: [ keystoneauth1.exceptions.connection.ConnectFailure: Unable to establish connection to http://10.0.0.110:5000 ]
Apr 12 06:37:28 [979787] controller-1 stonith-ng: warning: log_action: fence_compute[261144] stderr: [ REQ: curl -g -i -X GET http://10.0.0.110:5000 -H "Accept: application/json" -H "User-Agent: python-keystoneclient" ]
Apr 12 06:37:28 [979787] controller-1 stonith-ng: warning: log_action: fence_compute[261144] stderr: [ Starting new HTTP connection (1): 10.0.0.110 ]
Apr 12 06:37:28 [979787] controller-1 stonith-ng: warning: log_action: fence_compute[261144] stderr: [ keystoneauth1.exceptions.connection.ConnectFailure: Unable to establish connection to http://10.0.0.110:5000 ]

By setting the resource-stickiness of the VIPs to INFINITY we control how strongly they prefer to stay running where they are.

Change-Id: I6862452d2250ac4c2c3e04840983510a3cd13536
Closes-Bug: #1763586

commit_message:
Add host field to InstanceActionEvent

This patch adds the host field and obj_make_compatible with
InstanceActionEvent 1.2 version.

We record the event host info in event start method, and do
NOT record the host again in event finish method, because
it's the same event db record which is looked up by the
existing action(via request id) and event name from the
start event, the host of starting and ending is also same.

This would be used by instance action API to show the
``host`` information of the action event occurs.

Part of blueprint: add-host-to-instance-action-events

Change-Id: I356e7eb6b18837cf868bade7babaed96e5828688

commit_message:
Rename #openstack-101 to #openstack-dev

Now that the #openstack-101 IRC channel has been retired update
the sides to point to #openstack-dev.

Change-Id: I74663ba18d6812969588ce908fba633efefcd07d

subject: Enables ironic list commands to use labels

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 23704, 'date': '2016-09-30 23:46:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

The Resources Class in resource_fields.py only took field_ids as input.

revisions:
[{'created': '2016-09-30 23:41:38.000000000', 'message': 'This fix enables ironic list commands to use fields and labels in the arguments
Ironic list commands (such as node list, port list etc) did not take resource label as input. After the fix, in addition to providing resource.fields and resource.labels in the error message, it also takes labels as input
Closes-Bug:#1509191

Change-Id: I15972d9e8d473d2f85b32eb745f3768d92970d0a
'}, {'created': '2016-10-01 01:18:31.000000000', 'message': 'This fix enables ironic list commands to use fields and labels in the arguments
Ironic list commands (such as node list, port list etc) did not take resource label as input. After the fix, in addition to providing resource.fields and resource.labels in the error message, it also takes labels as input
Closes-Bug:#1509191

Change-Id: I15972d9e8d473d2f85b32eb745f3768d92970d0a
'}, {'created': '2016-10-01 01:47:41.000000000', 'message': 'This fix enables ironic list commands to use fields and labels in the arguments
Ironic list commands (such as node list, port list etc) did not take resource label as input. After the fix, in addition to providing resource.fields and resource.labels in the error message, it also takes labels as input
Closes-Bug:#1509191

Change-Id: I15972d9e8d473d2f85b32eb745f3768d92970d0a
'}, {'created': '2016-10-01 15:13:52.000000000', 'message': 'Enables ironic list commands to use labels

Ironic list commands (such as node list, port list etc) did not take
resource label as input. After the fix, in addition to providing
resource.fields and resource.labels in the error message, it also
takes labels as input.

The problem was that resource_fields.py had a class called Resources
which only took field_ids as input. In the current fix, although it
still takes field_ids as input, but if a field label is provided as
input, it would also handle that and return tuple of field ids
using field label as input.

Closes-Bug:#1509191

Change-Id: I15972d9e8d473d2f85b32eb745f3768d92970d0a
'}, {'created': '2016-10-06 16:18:15.000000000', 'message': 'Enables ironic list commands to use labels

commit_message:
Enables ironic list commands to use labels

Ironic list commands (such as node list, port list etc) did not take
resource label as input. After the fix, in addition to providing
resource.fields and resource.labels in the error message, it also
takes labels as input.

The problem was that resource_fields.py had a class called Resources
which only took field_ids as input. In the current fix, although it
still takes field_ids as input, but if a field label is provided as
input, it would also handle that and return tuple of field ids
using field label as input.

Closes-Bug:#1509191

Change-Id: I15972d9e8d473d2f85b32eb745f3768d92970d0a

commit_message:
libvirt: move version to string in utils

This will be used outside the libvirt driver itself in subsequent
patches, so this is factoring it out so it can be used elsewhere
instead of duplicating it.

Signed-off-by: Sahid Orentino Ferdjaoui <sahid.ferdjaoui@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I2e77d7ae3666a4ce9e256f7757b5d3c6ba2495dd

commit_message:
Remove the branch specifier from the nova-multiattach job

For in-tree job definitions, the job is branch-specific
by design, so we don't need the stable branch exclusion
specifier as it won't run on those branches anyway since
it's not defined for those branches.

Related to https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/2001839
Related-Bug: #1763382

Change-Id: I78dead482e2ed8262745cb08c9f4ab71035adb33

Additional code branch for boot from volume case, would it be better to take unit numbers from DB (bdm) straightly converting to libvirt config?'}, {'account_id': 27999, 'date': '2018-03-22 09:45:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1

Lgtm'}, {'account_id': 27999, 'date': '2018-03-22 09:48:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Lgtm'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2018-03-22 16:22:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

> Thanks.
 > 
 > Two questions:
 > 
 > What logic is behind not having a unit number for the config drive
 > on ide bus?

The original changes that regressed boot-from-volume + config drive added incrementing unit numbering for virtio-scsi devices only (bus 'scsi'). So no other bus types should have unit numbers assigned by us.
 
 > Additional code branch for boot from volume case, would it be
 > better to take unit numbers from DB (bdm) straightly converting to
 > libvirt config?

What do you mean here? There are no unit numbers in the DB, they're generated on-the-fly when we go to create the config."}, {'account_id': 21813, 'date': '2018-03-23 10:48:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

> ... So no other bus types should have unit numbers assigned by us.

So, it is kind of a contract between nova and libvirt.

> ... they're generated on-the-fly when we go to create the config.

I mean here that we could add a new column for that, 
it gives us an atomic and manageable approach for units, probably not in that patch."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-03-29 23:19:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1

(2 comments)

Some musings inline about migrations, otherwise I'd like to see mdbooth and lyarwood take a look at this too before +2ing it."}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2018-04-04 14:33:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)

commit_message:
only increment disk address unit for scsi devices

We were erroneously incrementing the disk address unit attribute for
non-scsi devices, which resulted in inconsistent disk device naming and
addresses when SCSI devices were used along with non-SCSI devices (like
configdrive devices).

Also, we ensure that we assign unit number 0 for the boot volume of a
boot-from-volume instance.

Change-Id: Ia91e2f9c316e25394a0f41dc341d903dfcff6921
Co-authored-by: Mehdi Abaakouk <sileht@sileht.net>
Closes-bug: #1729584
Closes-bug: #1753394

commit_message:
Add RBAC tests for identity v3 project tags

This PS adds RBAC tests for the identity v3 project tags
API [0], whose policies can be found here: [1]. The
corresponding Tempest client is implemented in [2].

[0] https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/identity/v3/index.html#project-tags
[1] https://github.com/openstack/keystone/blob/19f9937e98473e4fab9f4ee5c86b23a2eaacfe0f/keystone/common/policies/project.py#L98-161
[2] Iec6b34c10ea1bd7103720c773b48ce130643115d

Depends-On: Iad6b3a88639bb4a0dc3aea5af2ba0162dfa19f96
Change-Id: I6024fbe89d3d8f673be223bd5a07b1068be12034

It's not experimental anymore and we'll actually make the default in

Change-Id: Ic8f7e633084376570fb9802dee23afe93b58d299
"}]
commit_message:
Stop saying that containerized undercloud is experimental

It's not experimental anymore and we'll actually make the default in
Rocky.

Change-Id: Ic8f7e633084376570fb9802dee23afe93b58d299

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-12 16:11:17.000000000', 'message': 'Switch pep8 job to python 3

pep8 under python 3 is more strict than under python 2, so to make
sure our projects meet the more strict standards we want to run the
pep8 jobs using python 3 by default.

Change-Id: Ief10b732be1294bf1f843291311c716b65e6b8be
'}]
commit_message:
Switch pep8 job to python 3

pep8 under python 3 is more strict than under python 2, so to make
sure our projects meet the more strict standards we want to run the
pep8 jobs using python 3 by default.

Change-Id: Ief10b732be1294bf1f843291311c716b65e6b8be

So I'm confused about why in policy.json (rather the cloudv3sample) we are support the notion of a domain admin. The ethos of our regular policy.json is that cloud admin can do everything - i.e. there is no "admin delegation"....that's what cloudv3sample implements. So why wouldn't the changes to the admin_required rule be enough? If the answer is that we want domain tokens to be able to be cloud admin (as they could today), then maybe the right answer is to allow is_admin_project to be placed on a project acting as a domain, and for is_admin_project to be visible via a domain token.'}, {'account_id': 2218, 'date': '2017-01-09 15:45:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 15:

(4 comments)

None of my comments from patch sets 20 & 21 have been addressed, and they're all still valid. Some are simple (identity/controllers.py and token_model.py). Some seem to be bugs in this implementation (resource/controllers.py). It's extremely frustrating to see those go completely unaddressed through all the revisions that have happened since those comments were given.

And then there's the larger issue with the change in policies/base.py. After several IRC debates, I don't think Adam and are any closer to resolving that. I told him I would try to make a couple changes we could agree on, but I struck out. The similar-to-his-proposal hack that I thought might work doesn't work any more than this proposal. I'm now convinced that the only way this can be fixed is adding scope checks in the code (not policy) one API at a time. Which is the right way to do it anyway, even if it isn't quick or easy."}, {'account_id': 2218, 'date': '2017-05-02 01:37:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 25.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-05-02 02:12:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 25: Verified-1

commit_message:
Add is_admin_project check to policy for non scoped operations

If an operation is not scoped to a project, only calls
from a token scoped to the admin project should be used.

This patch makes an exception for the Service token
that is used to validate other tokens, as that is likely
to break many deployments.  That operation will be addressed
in a separately to avoid delaying this change for
the most essential and sensitive operations.

Domain and Service operations are also often performed with
tokens scoped to the default domain that contain admin roles.
This pattern has been "grandfathered in" as well.

Partial-Bug: 968696

Change-Id: Ibfa6c076f7a657aeeb1d1fc943c8040e115c765f

subject: Admin API policy enforcement contingent on is_admin_project

We have some documentation around our policy file. Could you update it to document this new rule, Adam?

Further, could you comment here with a good way to test that this does what it promises?'}, {'account_id': 12807, 'date': '2016-10-11 19:05:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

adding to Ian's comments:

because of the impact of changes to policy files, which are operator customizable and potentially managed by configuration management systems, we should have a release note[1] for added specifically for this item.  The release note only needs 'upgrade' and 'fixes' section entries.

This property must be managed by keystone or policies only IMO. So glance must get rid of this property."}, {'account_id': 10608, 'date': '2016-12-16 13:18:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

@Kairat it does seem like https://github.com/openstack/glance/blob/48ee8ef4793ed40397613193f09872f474c11abe/glance/api/middleware/context.py#L195 should be referring to the context_is_admin policy rule rather than to this conf setting, for consistency. commit_message:
Admin API policy enforcement contingent on is_admin_project

In order for a user with the admin role to be able to perform
administrative actions, the role must be assigned to a project
that is deemed the "admin" project in the Keystone server.
This prevents someone being assigned admin on some random
project from being admin everywhere.

Co-Authored-By: Tin Lam <tin@irrational.io>
Change-Id: I94da64ef20fd8a01ddf17a51acbd89a982b46327
Closes-Bug: 968696

subject: Add is_admin_project check to policy for token validations

'}, {'created': '2016-10-14 15:47:55.000000000', 'message': 'API Policy enforcement contingent on is_admin_project

In order for a user with the admin role to be able to perform
administrative actions beyond their current project, that project
must be deemed the "admin" project in the Keystone server.

This prevents someone being assigned admin on some random project
from being admin everywhere.

Note that there is a transition mechanism implemented in oslo-context
that prevents this change from breaking existing deployments.  If
no key 'is_admin-project" exists in the token's auth-data, oslo-context
defaults the value to true.  This protects Nova against breaking when a
Keystone server has not yet been updated.  Once Keystone sets the value
in the auth-data, Nova will endforce on the corresponding
'is_admin_project' value.


Co-Authored-By:Matthew Edmonds <edmondsw@us.ibm.com>

Change-Id: I5b7dc9be639354e246722369566641a666df6284
Closes-Bug: 968696

commit_message:
Admin API Policy contingent on is_admin_project

In order for a user with the admin role to be able to perform
administrative actions beyond their current project, that project
must be deemed the "admin" project in the Keystone server.

This prevents someone being assigned admin on some random project
from being admin everywhere.

Note that there is a transition mechanism implemented in
oslo-context that prevents this change from breaking
existing deployments.  If no key 'is_admin_project" exists
in the token's auth-data, oslo-context defaults the value
to true.  This protects Nova against breaking when a
Keystone server has not yet been updated.  Once Keystone
sets the value in the auth-data, Nova will enforce on
the corresponding 'is_admin_project' value.

Co-Authored-By: Matthew Edmonds <edmondsw@us.ibm.com>

Change-Id: I5b7dc9be639354e246722369566641a666df6284
Closes-Bug: 968696

task but, if the files doesn't exist the post job will also fail.

This patch is verifying if the ovnsb_db.db file exist [0] prior to trying
to copy and compact them.

[0] The ovnsb_db.db file was choosen because it's the last one of the
the db files that will be created.

Change-Id: I9f12f5113ef23c236167f3dbe53016e1351e7f13
"}, {'created': '2018-04-13 12:47:54.000000000', 'message': "Zuul: Avoid POST_FAILURE when OVSDB files doen't exist

If a job fails before the OVSDB files are created they are being marked
as POST_FAILURE instead of only FAILURE by the gate. This is because the
post job will try to copy the OVSDB files as part of the collection logs
task but, if the files doesn't exist the post job will also fail.

This patch is verifying if the ovnsb_db.db file exist [0] prior to trying
to copy and compact them.

This patch is also inverting the order of the post file to first check
the databases and compact it and then collect the logs. Otherwise the
databases won't show up in the logs.

[0] The ovnsb_db.db file was choosen because it's the last one of the
the db files that will be created.

Change-Id: I9f12f5113ef23c236167f3dbe53016e1351e7f13
"}]
commit_message:
Zuul: Avoid POST_FAILURE when OVSDB files doen't exist

If a job fails before the OVSDB files are created they are being marked
as POST_FAILURE instead of only FAILURE by the gate. This is because the
post job will try to copy the OVSDB files as part of the collection logs
task but, if the files doesn't exist the post job will also fail.

This patch is verifying if the ovnsb_db.db file exist [0] prior to trying
to copy and compact them.

This patch is also inverting the order of the post file to first check
the databases and compact it and then collect the logs. Otherwise the
databases won't show up in the logs.

[0] The ovnsb_db.db file was choosen because it's the last one of the
the db files that will be created.

Change-Id: I9f12f5113ef23c236167f3dbe53016e1351e7f13

commit_message:
Handle new line while adding tripleo-upgrade requirement

Review [1] added tripleo-upgrade to quickstart-requirements
but since ansible copy module [2] doesn't insert new line
in the quickstart-requirements, we need to handle it here.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/558210/
[1] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras/tree/roles/nodepool-setup/tasks/clone-ci-repos.yml#n31

Change-Id: I03aed0b90ca19d14250bddf9d06cd4f148f6dfe0

commit_message:
Stop updating port status when Felix times out.

During scale testing, we found that updating port statuses
to error when Felix went down could cause DoS due to the
overhead/amplification.  Stop doing that.

Change-Id: Icc99f53222f632ba64f744b3c0e8098788710489

commit_message:
Fail more gracefully when passed an empty ip

Introduce a new function called is_ip_addresses which will verify
if a string or an array of strings are composed of correct ip addresses.

We do this in order to fail a bit more clearly if we are passed an empty
or broken ip address. Without this the failure will be in pacemaker
failing to start a VIP called 'ip-'.

Also convert the only use of legacy is_ip_address stdlib function in
mysql::client to this new function (for consistency reasons).

Suggested-by: Rhys Oxenham <roxenham@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Ie15c585a9a902b577f35a75de191bfa91c132668

commit_message:
set default python to python3

Set the default python to python3 except for the py27 environment. We
have to set that explicitly to override the new default.

Change-Id: I3fa047b21fa6bc6e5bdf3222287fdce31c5ccef2
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-12 16:28:23.000000000', 'message': 'Switch pep8 job to python 3

pep8 under python 3 is more strict than under python 2, so to make
sure our projects meet the more strict standards we want to run the
pep8 jobs using python 3 by default.

Change-Id: Ice3cffa36e9167f2f1f30337372cf9187af5e02e
'}]
commit_message:
Switch pep8 job to python 3

pep8 under python 3 is more strict than under python 2, so to make
sure our projects meet the more strict standards we want to run the
pep8 jobs using python 3 by default.

Change-Id: Ice3cffa36e9167f2f1f30337372cf9187af5e02e

commit_message:
Add Neutron L3 agent failover check during upgrade

This change adds suppport for validating that a router created on
the overcloud before upgrade remains active on the same node between
the various steps of the upgrade process and does not failover.

Change-Id: I1273367fb07bda5cdacb538081a87f9d3e5ece3c
(cherry picked from commit 71aaf58e6f263321c6119bcb2ae9f6f93176941d)

[{'created': '2018-02-27 20:03:19.000000000', 'message': 'Mount netns as shared to persist namespaces

Dataplane is breaking when containers are killed. Keeping the namespaces
around allows the network objects (ports, bridges) etc. to remain
intact without the containers running.

Closes-Bug: #1748658
Change-Id: I092500e9ec0820347ba0f865f3c24f828980af3a
(cherry picked from commit fb27465c6fb734d7106130765f918ed91bc329ad)
'}]
commit_message:
Mount netns as shared to persist namespaces

Dataplane is breaking when containers are killed. Keeping the namespaces
around allows the network objects (ports, bridges) etc. to remain
intact without the containers running.

Closes-Bug: #1748658
Change-Id: I092500e9ec0820347ba0f865f3c24f828980af3a
(cherry picked from commit fb27465c6fb734d7106130765f918ed91bc329ad)

commit_message:
Deprecate auth_uri option

Option auth_uri from group keystone_authtoken is deprecated[1].
Use option www_authenticate_uri from group keystone_authtoken.

[1]https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508522/

Change-Id: I034f67b503bb1f579c18bc3b61208984e577d6ba
Depends-On: I4c82a63baabd6b9304b302c97cd751a0103d8316
Closes-Bug: #1759098

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-11 20:24:05.000000000', 'message': 'Add GPG-KEY-ceph

At first, I thought this would go in puppet-ceph, but in fact,
every compute node needs a librados dependency which is in the
Ceph repo. So at then end, all nodes need GPG-KEY-ceph, so it
is a good idea to install the repository key there.

Change-Id: Ia33718a8350a60c69ce9632eddb6156f9b43c745
'}]
commit_message:
Add GPG-KEY-ceph

At first, I thought this would go in puppet-ceph, but in fact,
every compute node needs a librados dependency which is in the
Ceph repo. So at then end, all nodes need GPG-KEY-ceph, so it
is a good idea to install the repository key there.

Change-Id: Ia33718a8350a60c69ce9632eddb6156f9b43c745

commit_message:
Improved local_ip parameter description in OVS manifest

For some reason VXLAN tunnels are not mentioned in local_ip
parameter's description, which could be mesleading during
troubleshooting.

Change-Id: Ib73808b9ea6318ea98908985e4c640980000f663

commit_message:
vhostuser socket dir shall be created for vhostuserclient mode

In order to support vhostuser client mode, a vhostuser_socket_dir
needs to be created with qemu:qemu g+w permissions.

Closes-Bug: #1675690

Co-Authored-By: Sanjay Upadhyay <supadhya@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I255f98c40869e7508ed01a03a96294284ecdc6a8
Signed-off-by: Karthik S <ksundara@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 2556c56b5b8bb84b1846683bb4a21881b35fad08)

option "region_name" from group "placement".

commit_message:
Add proxy support to glance_image resource

The glance_image resource provides the ability to
download remote images using the source parameter.
Specifying the proxy parameter will allow one to
use a proxy server when downloading the image.

Change-Id: I540a29be3eb6c95b1c3975228c23c9154b1a0cbe
Closes-Bug: 1719874

commit_message:
Update Zuul branch limit

Now mitaka and newton already mark as EOL, so we should remove any
branch limit that relative to those branches.

Also since we have dependent zuul jobs for each branch, we remove
ocata branch limit from master.

Change-Id: Ide2ddbe4d50faa0356992b55d99c1b1af8a44a35
(cherry picked from commit ee56adbd791e0ede9c3d92ab0a776d1776de6d47)

commit_message:
Run identity client relations when db is complete

When keystone is deployed with multiple units but without hacluster one
off scenarios occur where one non-leader unit will fail to update its
client relations.

This change runs all identity client relations when the database
relation is complete thus guaranteeing all keystone units update there
identity relation data with clients.

Small timing fix to amulet tests.

Closes-Bug: #1761562
Change-Id: I338e500dbc155b75c75b9261a9b5b471bd73088a

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-12 11:10:09.000000000', 'message': "Fix potential race condition in privileged ip_lib module

Functions like _run_iproute_{link,addr,neigh} are not atomic and
works in two steps.
First it tries to get device index and in second step call specified
command for this device.
It might happen sometimes that device exists during first of those
steps but not exists during second step. Such case cause raising
pyroute2.NetlinkError exception which isn't properly handled in
Neutron code which uses ip_lib module.

This patch fixes it by catching pyroute2.NetlinkError exception
and raising NetworkInterfaceNotFound.
This is child of RuntimeError and all callers of ip_lib can handle
it properly is needed.

Change-Id: I568ef183466f5ff2f2c30ed74a7dc52db41ba577
Closes-Bug: #1763329
"}, {'created': '2018-04-13 07:39:32.000000000', 'message': "Fix potential race condition in privileged ip_lib module

Functions like _run_iproute_{link,addr,neigh} are not atomic and
work in two steps.
First it tries to get device index and in second step calls specified
command for this device.
It might happen sometimes that device exists during first of those
steps but not exists during second step. Such case causes raising

Neutron code which uses ip_lib module.

This patch fixes it by catching pyroute2.NetlinkError exception
and raising NetworkInterfaceNotFound.
This is subclass of RuntimeError and all callers of ip_lib can handle

Change-Id: I568ef183466f5ff2f2c30ed74a7dc52db41ba577
Closes-Bug: #1763329
"}]
commit_message:
Fix potential race condition in privileged ip_lib module

Functions like _run_iproute_{link,addr,neigh} are not atomic and
work in two steps.
First it tries to get device index and in second step calls specified
command for this device.
It might happen sometimes that device exists during first of those
steps but not exists during second step. Such case causes raising
pyroute2.NetlinkError exception which isn't properly handled in
Neutron code which uses ip_lib module.

This patch fixes it by catching pyroute2.NetlinkError exception
and raising NetworkInterfaceNotFound.
This is subclass of RuntimeError and all callers of ip_lib can handle
it properly is needed.

Change-Id: I568ef183466f5ff2f2c30ed74a7dc52db41ba577
Closes-Bug: #1763329

recheck'}, {'account_id': 13294, 'date': '2018-04-04 13:06:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

We need to do more than this to deprecate auth_uri. Since https://review.openstack.org/558344 was merged, several Puppet providers have been broken (at least puppet-nova and puppet-cinder are, but several others are possibly affected).

The reason is in https://github.com/openstack/puppet-cinder/blob/master/lib/puppet/provider/cinder.rb#L54-L86 . The provider checks for the existence of the auth_uri option in cinder.conf, then fails because it is not available. Also, self.get_auth_endpoint should be changed to use www_authenticate_uri.'}, {'account_id': 9414, 'date': '2018-04-05 02:33:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 9414, 'date': '2018-04-05 03:49:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 9414, 'date': '2018-04-05 05:54:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

commit_message:
Document undercloud --verbose option

Document that operators can now control if they want verbose deployment
or not:

  openstack undercloud install --use-heat --verbose
  openstack undercloud upgrade --use-heat --verbose

Change-Id: I0b58bfe0fdd2aa6b64ca6bb5c5e911ad138bdf3e
Depends-On: I807e3cacf224e58d2b96855e119ed0aaeebc5e26

commit_message:
Upgrade the content for containerized undercloud

- installing: document how to deploy a containerized undercloud and
  mention that we only support that starting from Rocky cycle.
- updating: document how to upgrade a non containerized undercloud
  on Queens to a containerized undercloud on Rocky.
- containers_deployment/undercloud: consolidate what we had before
  (remove outdated bits), and add links to deploy/upgrade/tips pages.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/546024

Change-Id: Ibd6c8794f3d6a64f65e9a9f0f8b15a472d8424d1

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-13 09:53:58.000000000', 'message': 'Use cached cirros image

Jobs are downloading the image from cirros (which leads sometimes to dns
error) even though the image is cached locally. Change it to use the
local cirros image instead of download it again

Change-Id: I5f9607bc029a68f4a73a12305ea8e1d605551f15
'}]
commit_message:
Use cached cirros image

Jobs are downloading the image from cirros (which leads sometimes to dns
error) even though the image is cached locally. Change it to use the
local cirros image instead of download it again

Change-Id: I5f9607bc029a68f4a73a12305ea8e1d605551f15

recheck'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-04-05 20:09:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 25: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2018-04-05 20:39:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 25:

I don't see how this does the right thing. All host services are still enabled, so after a reboot they would be started.

Also mariadb/rabbitmq/etc are still running on the host and are never stopped.

Is the point of this patch that everything is switched over to containers after undercloud install --use-heat finishes? Is there other context?"}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-04-05 23:56:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 25: Workflow-1

Good feedback James.

> I don't see how this does the right thing. All host services are still enabled, so after a reboot they would be started.

Indeed, I haven't solved that yet, and I'll push a new patchset for that.

> Also mariadb/rabbitmq/etc are still running on the host and are never stopped.

For mariadb, it's stopped here: https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/blob/master/docker/services/database/mysql.yaml#L254-L264
The database in instack-undercloud was named "neutron" but to be consistent with THT, we rename it to "ovs_neutron", after the rename the process is stopped by Ansible.

For rabbitmq, indeed we need to stop it.

> Is the point of this patch that everything is switched over to containers after undercloud install --use-heat finishes? Is there other context?

The point of this patch is to provide an upgrade path like:

- Undercloud is deployed on Queens and isn't containerized.
- I would like to upgrade to Rocky, and containerize the undercloud.
- I run "openstack undercloud upgrade --use-heat" and it'll perform the upgrade / migration to containers.

I was trying to avoid to use the upgrade_tasks until now, because they have some logic that was specific to the overcloud. But I can reconsider it if we find that too much logic resides in tripleoclient.

Setting WIP now, as I need to keep working on it.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-04-06 00:08:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 25:

After some discussion on IRC with James, he had the great idea of investigating a UndercloudUpgrade service template with host_prep_tasks to upgrade an undercloud.

I'll go that path."}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-04-06 02:32:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 26.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-04-06 02:33:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 27: Patch Set 26 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 10873, 'date': '2018-04-06 06:09:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 27: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-04-06 20:12:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 28: Published edit on patch set 27.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-04-10 02:41:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 29: Patch Set 28 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-04-10 02:41:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 30: Published edit on patch set 29.'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2018-04-10 08:44:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 30: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2018-04-10 08:45:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 30: -Code-Review

commit_message:
Manage upgrades to a containerized undercloud

The workflow will be the following:
openstack undercloud upgrade --use-heat

Which will deploy with the UndercloudUpgrade service in THT, in charge
of taking care of tearing down the services running on baremetal, and
then running a classic install by keeping the data.

Depends-On: I36be7f398dcd91e332687c6222b3ccbb9cd74ad2
Change-Id: If8e276cf2758556fcd8d2461b5b841e68fe1b228

commit_message:
Do container image prepare during undercloud deploy

This change consumes the ContainerImagePrepare parameter during
"openstack undercloud deploy" to populate the container image
parameters. This includes doing tag discovery if tag_from_label is
set, and image uploads if push_destination is set.

Rather than creating a separate environment file for these parameters,
the parameters are set directly in the environment if that parameter is
not already set.

Change-Id: I00f72b1cd7ab6a03dd42bc489f3c950ee32dedeb
Blueprint: containerized-undercloud

commit_message:
use rpc Connection rather than create_connection

The create_connection function in neutron.common.rpc is just an alias to
Connection. This patch switches to the later so we can remove the former
in: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/560130

Change-Id: I72a8219fc57d2601500cf45312a90a34e493ee54

commit_message:
Handle AgentNotFoundByTypeHost exception properly

During listing router_ids on host it is possible that on some hosts
there are no L3 agents.
In such case AgentNotFoundByTypeHost exception is raised in
neutron.db.agents_db module in _get_agent_by_type_and_host() method.
Now this exception is properly handled during listing routers on host.

Change-Id: Ia5ff1b57ef63c98b4ada4f2d46c45336e413be3d
Closes-Bug: #1737917
(cherry picked from commit 7b0f6330d6f877f3d2093a64c2bca4c14334574c)

commit_message:
Removes odl-dlux-gui feature for ODL

The GUI feature is no longer supported with ODL and needs to be removed.
We relied on the URL provided by this feature in order to run our docker
healtcheck, which is modified in the depends-on patch to a new URI.

Depends-On: I2f33d2cf6a96005ef1d18468a8d2fcc71b17b6f8

Related-Bug: 1751857

Change-Id: I762789e65913b4f653bbf9019b5d3d05903912f1
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-11 19:48:59.000000000', 'message': 'Fixes ODL healthcheck URI

In the past we used index.html to ensure ODL container was healthy.
This page was provided by the GUI plugins into ODL.  Now that those
plugins are no longer supported, we need to move to a more reliable URI
path.

Related-Bug: 1751857

Change-Id: I2f33d2cf6a96005ef1d18468a8d2fcc71b17b6f8
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes ODL healthcheck URI

In the past we used index.html to ensure ODL container was healthy.
This page was provided by the GUI plugins into ODL.  Now that those
plugins are no longer supported, we need to move to a more reliable URI
path.

Related-Bug: 1751857

Change-Id: I2f33d2cf6a96005ef1d18468a8d2fcc71b17b6f8
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>

commit_message:
fix lower constraints and uncap eventlet

Fix the lower constraints values to match the expected values.

We will manage the eventlet version using constraints now. See the
thread starting at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/129096.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I1ff1e6af8906539340a768cf68af3b9c388885ac
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Add the option to only aggregate hosts that are known by openstack to be active

Adding a parameter to the nova_aggregate type to only add hosts to a host
aggregate that are known by openstack to be active and corresponding handling
of said parameter to the nova_aggregate/openstack provider.

Change-Id: Ie08e7c37cdd711baf9beb3fcc92b4bcb520afca0
(cherry picked from commit 4c34d868ffb010f052b69382aa9447becf690cf3)

commit_message:
Show team and repo badges on README

This patch adds the team's and repository's badges to the README file.
The motivation behind this is to communicate the project status and
features at first glance.

For more information about this effort, please read this email thread:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-October/105562.html

To see an example of how this would look like check:

https://gist.github.com/1c8b7ec0a4a119dc5e39e8a4ffde8a33

Change-Id: I30fd3aa5f2139ae46f0f90cb899204b39e115547

commit_message:
Add info about building the v1 api-ref

Because the Image API is removed in Rocky, its API Reference has
been deleted.  Add information about why it's gone and how to build
it to the current API Reference.

Closes-bug: #1762387

Change-Id: Ic215e7367b49df1ac837a4a1fa56effa7d9f7a61

[{'created': '2018-04-13 10:39:20.000000000', 'message': "tests: Fix how context managers are mocked

Two issues here:

- The mock library provides a 'mock_open' function to mock the 'open'
  builtin's context manager. We should have been using this but were
  not.
- We were mocking another context manager in a fairly strange way. This
  seems to be causing issues, possibly down to race. We shouldn't do
  that.

Fix both issues.

Change-Id: I289b56ae3f9ccd16d72b2ca317e68e6c18b8b313
Fixes-Bug: #1763535
"}]
commit_message:
tests: Fix how context managers are mocked

Two issues here:

- The mock library provides a 'mock_open' function to mock the 'open'
  builtin's context manager. We should have been using this but were
  not.
- We were mocking another context manager in a fairly strange way. This
  seems to be causing issues, possibly down to race. We shouldn't do
  that.

Fix both issues.

Change-Id: I289b56ae3f9ccd16d72b2ca317e68e6c18b8b313
Fixes-Bug: #1763535

commit_message:
Fix novajoin FreeIPA server parameter

We need the FreeIPA server hostname in order to request the kerberos
keytab for the novajoin process. For the containerized case, we
assume that the node is enrolled to FreeIPA before puppet is ran.
This, however, is not the case for the baremetal case, since puppet
calls the FreeIPA enrollment. Thus, we need to handle this case.

Change-Id: If73a7b674536df33c32507977941be784f82e8f4
Closes-Bug: #1761786

It looks good to me but this change moves away from rendering the commands into script files. I just want to make sure that we all agree on this and we don't want to create bash scripts anymore but run the commands as Ansible tasks instead. 

The use case for creating script files first was that it allowed the user to run tripleo-upgrade and _only_ create the script files. These could be later easily triggered manually from the undercloud when reproducing bugs or doing development work."}, {'account_id': 26343, 'date': '2018-03-16 06:54:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

commit_message:
Re-use undercloud upgrades tasks.

Both upgrades and updates rely on a previous
undercloud upgrade step to run. Currently,
both were implementing its own tasks for upgrading
the undercloud. So, this patch brings them both
together into a single template.

Change-Id: Icb66a4a69bf04c30155999d374b413204df7fc82

[{'created': '2018-04-10 09:17:43.000000000', 'message': 'Fix K8s API access through LBaaS on gates

In the gate K8s API was inaccessible through the LB we create for it.
This means that we could only connect to the API directly through
HOST_IP.

This commit fixes the issue by adding required iptables rule that allows
traffic to the LB and fixes up the member IP added to the LB.

Change-Id: Icd53ec45a479d54015d0506fb5e8bb9896d0a9df
Related-Bug: 555040

commit_message:
Fix K8s API access through LBaaS on gates

In the gate K8s API was inaccessible through the LB we create for it.
This means that we could only connect to the API directly through
HOST_IP.

This commit fixes the issue by adding required iptables rule that allows
traffic to the LB and fixes up the member IP added to the LB.

Change-Id: Icd53ec45a479d54015d0506fb5e8bb9896d0a9df
Related-Bug: 555040

commit_message:
Remove undercloud-prep-containers.sh.j2

We don't need to run the image prepare commands for the containerized
undercloud anymore.
It's now done by tripleoclient during the "undercloud deploy" process.

Depends-On: I00f72b1cd7ab6a03dd42bc489f3c950ee32dedeb
Change-Id: Ic2868b4c8ec433918d4eae87b4ccd374171d05a0

* Improving formatting in accordance to rst standart
* Adding sudo rm -rf /var/cache/yum after yum clean all

Change-Id: Ia08f205ec880ebe0a972c99d730345d9140dbf46

I'd prefer if you reused upgrade_steps_tasks or create new config named undercloud_upgrade_tasks. The host_prep_tasks should be used only by deployment to ensure the correct files/paths are in place."}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-04-11 12:58:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

Lukas, this question has been asked many times already, let me re-explain:
re-using the upgrade_tasks for the undercloud wasn't that easy because some bits were too overcloud related, specially because the tasks were designed for upgrades from ocata to pike, when we containerized the overcloud.

In the case of the undercloud, it's a bit "easier", where we just tear down the service, and run a fresh undercloud install. The data won't be purged and containers will re-use the same database, and other data, so it's working pretty nicely. The host_prep_tasks is just used to teardown what was working on the host before running the fresh install, and nothing else done in upgrade_tasks are needed.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-04-11 13:01:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

An example of why we don't use the upgrade_tasks again is because they were created for the overcloud and have too much logic for it.
e.g. Nova upgrade: controlling openstack-nova-migration service, while we don't have that on the undercloud. We would need to skip it, but same for many other tasks... I figured it was easier to just create tasks that will be run on this specific use case. When talking to the upgrade folks in Dublin and after, we figured it was ok."}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-04-11 13:08:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

Note: I would like to move forward with this one, please. I'll add a release note explaining our technical choices in a separated patch, and also change the path, like Marios suggested."}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2018-04-11 13:29:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

I would be strongly opposed of adding undercloud_upgrade_tasks. that defeats the very purpose of heat installer for undercloud. If we have a blessing of upgrade team folks, and acked that host_upgrade_tasks will not collide with upgrade_steps in unexpected for overclouds ways, I'm fine to go with that as is."}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-04-11 13:51:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 18851, 'date': '2018-04-11 15:31:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2018-04-11 16:41:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review-1

This service will be used to upgrade a non containerized undercloud to a
containerized undercloud, by using Ansible with the host_prep_tasks
interface.

Workflow will be:

- Services will be stopped and disabled (except mariadb)
- Neutron DB will be renamed, then mariadb stopped & disabled
- All packages will be upgraded with yum update.

commit_message:
Handle undercloud upgrades via host_prep_tasks

Using host_prep_tasks interface to handle undercloud teardown before we
run the undercloud install.
The reason of not using upgrade_tasks is because the existing tasks were
created for the overcloud upgrade first and there are too much logic
right now so we can easily re-use the bits for the undercloud. In the
future, we'll probably use upgrade_tasks for both the undercloud and
overcloud but right now this is not possible and a simple way to move
forward was to implement these tasks that work fine for the undercloud
containerization case.

Workflow will be:
- Services will be stopped and disabled (except mariadb)
- Neutron DB will be renamed, then mariadb stopped & disabled
- Remove cron jobs
- All packages will be upgraded with yum update.

Change-Id: I36be7f398dcd91e332687c6222b3ccbb9cd74ad2

commit_message:
Pass env-files and roles-data file to update/upgrade prepare cli.

To bypass issue described in RHBZ#1541024 it's needed to pass
 all the environment files, used during initial overcloud deploy,
to the 'overcloud update|upgrade prepare' cli.

Depends-On: I9db2c9256ed20d4d0b74bb467ee6ae0a9633bcc8
Change-Id: I9b488d84fa6e86ed9ce03c7b5fda5d42f713724d

commit_message:
Stop persisting previous configuration on update/upgrade prepare

We've been getting a number of errors related to this persistence
(e.g. LP#1758406 or rhbz#1541024). It doesn't seem feasible to
continue to fix them one by one, we should go back to requiring users
pass their -e files to the prepare command.

Related-Bug: #1758406
Change-Id: I9db2c9256ed20d4d0b74bb467ee6ae0a9633bcc8
(cherry picked from commit 18efb193c1162b93a25761d70433d9b18b39c7bf)

commit_message:
Raise CNI plugins version to v0.7.0

Starting from version v0.7.0 CNI plugins are placed in a new repository.
This commit switches version installed by OpenShift DevStack plugin to
that repo and raises the version.

Change-Id: I99c560b4c83396ef431439b73f57445652d83871

commit_message:
Include md5 in function package path

This is the preliminary patch for function versioning support. In order
to create a new function version, we need to check if the function
package data has been changed compared with the latest version.

The package md5 is stored as part of the package file path.

Change-Id: Icf7c3999033989762b31bb629571bab6ad06b05e
Story: #2001829
Task: #12586

commit_message:
Fix the build and source directories for api-guide

Since I02e882786677f279c89614c2f5d295153e489a36,
The build and source directories for api-guide have been changed
to 'api-ref/build' and 'api-ref/source'.
But they should be 'api-guide/build' and 'api-guide/source'.

Change-Id: Ica1ec67896088c61400e645e4324e0e5507f28cd

commit_message:
Change permissions on SSL keys to 640

This tightens up the security on the SSL keys stored in
/etc/apache2/ssl/<service> to be no longer world readable.

Change-Id: I0951deff4ec95b1fc7f4389dc083c8957f8db6f0
Closes-Bug: #1761305

My guess is that the "Repodata is over 2 weeks old" message goes to stderr which makes the whole validation fail. Maybe we should be more liberal and not fail on any stderr text present, as long as stdout contains the expected output?

(3 comments)

> I tested this and got it to fail in a case when it shouldn't, I
 > think. See the output of testing here: https://paste.fedoraproject.org/paste/yM3PxnvQH76Sn3JNk8hOFg
 > 
 > My guess is that the "Repodata is over 2 weeks old" message goes to
 > stderr which makes the whole validation fail. Maybe we should be
 > more liberal and not fail on any stderr text present, as long as
 > stdout contains the expected output?

Wow, that's a good catch! :-)

So if the repodata is that stale -- doesn't it mean we cannot determine if there is a new version (because the validation operates on outdated data) and should let the validation fail rather than try to catch that error? (But maybe we should make the output a bit clearer in that case and add some instructions to clear the repo cache, or something similar.)'}, {'account_id': 17888, 'date': '2018-04-12 15:37:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 9317, 'date': '2018-04-12 17:20:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: Code-Review+2

Florian, that's a good point about the stale repodata. Thinking about it more, I think it is fine to leave it like that. Stale repodata issue should really be fixed first in order for the validation to work, and the error message indicates that clearly enough."}, {'account_id': 11491, 'date': '2018-04-13 09:32:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 11491, 'date': '2018-04-13 09:33:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+2'}]

commit_message:
Add a validation that checks for available update

This patch adds a validation that checks for newer versions of
python-tripleoclient. The check is done through the
check_package_update module which uses yum list to find available
versions of a package.

Change-Id: I19660980618fae318555401f5a7be01cb4d0ef2b

[{'created': '2018-04-12 10:53:38.000000000', 'message': 'Fix typo in ovn_cms_options config

ovn-cms-options config option is mistakenly added as ovn-cms-opts.
As a result ovn_cms_options is never set in SBDB and OVN
mechanism driver is unable to schedule router as expected.

Closes-Bug: 1763333
Change-Id: Iaa89a1dbec732c3aa743fa3f5cf1f4931e2ab9ef
(cherry picked from commit 1dc22496a956e66c65a701ef2e429d14fcffc772)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix typo in ovn_cms_options config

ovn-cms-options config option is mistakenly added as ovn-cms-opts.
As a result ovn_cms_options is never set in SBDB and OVN
mechanism driver is unable to schedule router as expected.

Closes-Bug: 1763333
Change-Id: Iaa89a1dbec732c3aa743fa3f5cf1f4931e2ab9ef
(cherry picked from commit 1dc22496a956e66c65a701ef2e429d14fcffc772)

Hi, thanks for your contribution. When I try to create the project I get:

commit_message:
Create tripleo-ha-utils project (gerrit)

As described in the spec [1] merged recently, this project aims to
contain all the tools, ansible playbooks and documentation to proper
test and verify all the specific HA bits of a TripleO deployment.

[1] http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/tripleo-specs/specs/rocky/tripleo-ha-utils.html

Needed-by: I7d6c3fdd2d1f17cd8c128a971c9d765032c48fe3
Change-Id: Ic2c0e036a35a02dd1fe40046047ff7bbad165ebe

commit_message:
Fix incompatible requirement

Fix lower-constraints don't match the lower bounds
in the requirements file(s). It may cause fail in
requirements-check.

A fail example: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/554702/

Reference:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/129056.html

Change-Id: Ic36fe9cb828d1b7cbe1cc7887f009eb2caeebb6c

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-06 00:50:07.000000000', 'message': 'NEC driver: Disallow access from the source node after live-migration.

NEC driver deletes access permission from nodes in the method
remove_export().
However, the method remove_export() is not called after live-migration.
After live-migration, access permission of the live-migration source
node is not deleted.

This patch adds the step to delete access permission from the node
in the method terminate_connection().
The terminate_connection() is called after live-migration and
access permission of the source node is deleted.

Change-Id: Id605eb6ff61cd1d382bf82173e6d65b986dda398
Closes-Bug: #1753375
(cherry picked from commit fcf09dedba94ea8eb41066345d5a8c2d69673384)
'}]
commit_message:
NEC driver: Disallow access from the source node after live-migration.

NEC driver deletes access permission from nodes in the method
remove_export().
However, the method remove_export() is not called after live-migration.
After live-migration, access permission of the live-migration source
node is not deleted.

This patch adds the step to delete access permission from the node
in the method terminate_connection().
The terminate_connection() is called after live-migration and
access permission of the source node is deleted.

Change-Id: Id605eb6ff61cd1d382bf82173e6d65b986dda398
Closes-Bug: #1753375
(cherry picked from commit fcf09dedba94ea8eb41066345d5a8c2d69673384)

[{'created': '2018-04-02 07:59:54.000000000', 'message': '[RFC] Pick next minimum libvirt / QEMU versions for "Stein"

The last time we incremented versions for libvirt and QEMU was during
the "Pike" release (commit: b980df0, 11-Feb-2017); for "Queens" we
didn't do any.  The advertized NEXT_MIN_{LIBVIRT,QEMU} versions during
"Pike" release were set to: libvirt 1.3.1 and QEMU 2.5.0 -- but they

3.2.0 and QEMU to 2.9.0.

commit_message:
Pick next minimum libvirt / QEMU versions for "Stein"

The last time we incremented versions for libvirt and QEMU was during
the "Pike" release (commit: b980df0, 11-Feb-2017); for "Queens" we
didn't do any.  The advertized NEXT_MIN_{LIBVIRT,QEMU} versions during
"Pike" release were set to: libvirt 1.3.1 and QEMU 2.5.0 -- but they
weren't actually bumped for "Queens".  They will be applied for the
"Rocky" release.

Based on the LibvirtDistroSupportMatrix[*], this patch announces a
version increment for libvirt and QEMU that will be applied for the
"Stein" release, with predicted minimum versions setting libvirt to
3.0.0 and QEMU to 2.8.0.

[*] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/LibvirtDistroSupportMatrix

Change-Id: I872304f99e3401f9c09d61b5511300ef9c5c7e8d

[{'created': '2018-04-10 11:05:05.000000000', 'message': 'libvirt: Block swapping to an encrypted volume when using QEMU to decrypt

The original check in Ibfa64f18bbd2fb70db7791330ed1a64fe61c1355 only
blocked swap volume _from_ an encrypted LUKS volume while using native
QEMU decryption. This change expands that check to also block swap
volume when swapping _to_ an encrypted LUKS volume while using native
QEMU decryption, regardless of the original volume being encrypted.

NOTE(lyarwood): The trivial typo fix Ia1e34df5a7e88c252924c25736ffb6bcaea42bfe
is also squashed into this backport to avoid a conflict.

Change-Id: I258127fdcd011ccec721d5ff62eb7f128f130336
Closes-bug: #1749418
(cherry picked from commit 7ceccee056cb8f50cb5efebd5156cfc56d8e4af7)
'}]
commit_message:
libvirt: Block swapping to an encrypted volume when using QEMU to decrypt

The original check in Ibfa64f18bbd2fb70db7791330ed1a64fe61c1355 only
blocked swap volume _from_ an encrypted LUKS volume while using native
QEMU decryption. This change expands that check to also block swap
volume when swapping _to_ an encrypted LUKS volume while using native
QEMU decryption, regardless of the original volume being encrypted.

NOTE(lyarwood): The trivial typo fix Ia1e34df5a7e88c252924c25736ffb6bcaea42bfe
is also squashed into this backport to avoid a conflict.

Change-Id: I258127fdcd011ccec721d5ff62eb7f128f130336
Closes-bug: #1749418
(cherry picked from commit 7ceccee056cb8f50cb5efebd5156cfc56d8e4af7)

commit_message:
A description can now be added to a security rule

This patch fixes Bug #1742332 (Security Rule Description neither
editable nor shown). I have added the option for a description
to be added to a security rule which will show the description
on the related table.

Co-Authored-By: Akihiro Motoki <amotoki@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Ie723deb412977ae460c1e897f5d71fc8dbb7a853
Closes-Bug: #1742332

commit_message:
Redirect back if deleting from image details

If deleting from the image details view, the user stuck on an empty
page, instead of redirecting back to the list of remaining images.

Change-Id: I9a2f5b7325e037c4b57cd01afc2bbcfca51e6e83
Closes-Bug: #1704118

commit_message:
Add links to trunk parent and subports

Add link to the parent port's detail page on the table view of trunks
panel, and add link to the subport's details page from the trunk details
page.

Closes-Bug: #1746082
Change-Id: I66fc525e02a8b4c5c77ed2e663c644e8e2e1a805

commit_message:
Fix navigation from admin/trunks

In case of the details of the trunk was reached from admin/trunks add
?nav=/admin/trunks to fix the navigation back to /admin/trunks.

Change-Id: Ie80484814f471a6f939991d1c93ffc7e895102bd

commit_message:
Add gentoo image to all providers

The new gentoo image [1] needs to be added to a provider before it will
get built.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/504530

Change-Id: I898cf2f596cb409e320419909381a3add6201ab3

[{'created': '2018-04-12 20:03:08.000000000', 'message': 'use rpc Connection rather than create_connection

The create_connection function in neutron.common.rpc is just an alias to
Connection. This patch switches to the later so we can remove the former
in: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/560130

Change-Id: Ie8eaca442fa2872fe061f997898d9cd7d9195c9d
'}]
commit_message:
use rpc Connection rather than create_connection

The create_connection function in neutron.common.rpc is just an alias to
Connection. This patch switches to the later so we can remove the former
in: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/560130

Change-Id: Ie8eaca442fa2872fe061f997898d9cd7d9195c9d

subject: [WIP][dashboard] Add bgpvpn port associations
messages:
[{'account_id': 21800, 'date': '2018-04-05 17:08:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 21800, 'date': '2018-04-05 17:08:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 21800, 'date': '2018-04-06 08:31:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 21800, 'date': '2018-04-06 08:31:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 21800, 'date': '2018-04-06 12:48:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 21800, 'date': '2018-04-06 12:48:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 21800, 'date': '2018-04-06 15:05:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 21800, 'date': '2018-04-06 15:06:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 21800, 'date': '2018-04-09 07:42:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 21800, 'date': '2018-04-09 08:01:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 21800, 'date': '2018-04-09 12:53:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 12021, 'date': '2018-04-13 13:02:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: Code-Review-1

(4 comments)

Thanks for this change Cédric, this will be usefull!
Comments below...

The port selection dialog as done in this change, will be hard to use:
- the user need to find the UUID it wants in the dropdown list (can't copy paste, can't CTRL-F easily)
- this will not be workable for a tenant with a number of ports that starts to be significant

I think we need a dialog that allows the user to select a port, whether:
- via a free form field in which one could paste a port UUID
- or by first selecting a network, then listing the ports in this network along with their IPs

Ideally the creation of a port association would be done via the Network / Port view.  This is, I understand, not doable today because this view, unlike the network and router views, does not have tabs."}]

[{'created': '2018-04-11 04:15:57.000000000', 'message': "Handle failed lookups from the OSF member DB

If a lookup for a member find no matches (perhaps an incorrect email
address) the resulting JSON has an empty 'data' element.  The existing
code assumed it would be missing altogether.

So check for an item in the list before trying to index the data.

While we're doing this, use the same code style for both get_fullname()
and get_irc() to remove points of confusion.

Change-Id: I4c899df5f93c27f5e5390c93e88741d24c0282d8
"}, {'created': '2018-04-11 22:34:56.000000000', 'message': "Handle failed lookups from the OSF member DB

If a lookup for a member find no matches (perhaps an incorrect email
address) the resulting JSON has an empty 'data' element.  The existing
code assumed it would be missing altogether.

So check for an item in the list before trying to index the data.

While we're doing this, use the same code style for both get_fullname()
and get_irc() to remove points of confusion.

Change-Id: I4c899df5f93c27f5e5390c93e88741d24c0282d8
"}]
commit_message:
Handle failed lookups from the OSF member DB

If a lookup for a member find no matches (perhaps an incorrect email
address) the resulting JSON has an empty 'data' element.  The existing
code assumed it would be missing altogether.

So check for an item in the list before trying to index the data.

While we're doing this, use the same code style for both get_fullname()
and get_irc() to remove points of confusion.

Change-Id: I4c899df5f93c27f5e5390c93e88741d24c0282d8

commit_message:
Update all SHAs for master

This patch updates all the roles to the latest available stable
SHA's, copies the release notes from the updated roles into the
integrated repo, updates all the OpenStack Service SHA's, and
updates the appropriate python requirements pins.

Change-Id: I76277f47d9216dde91dac7248bb1adbf3805af20

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-12 19:04:05.000000000', 'message': "Fix kernel post-installation script

`/etc/kernel/postinst.d/nova-kernel-permissions.sh` (introduced to fix Bug #1507915) is supposed to make newly installed kernels readable to the nova user, as kernels on an Ubuntu system are otherwise only readable to the root user [0].

This script didn't work for a few reasons:

- It never ran, because scripts in `/etc/kernel/postinst.d` are called by `run-parts`, and run-parts skips any script with a period in the name [1].
- Its shebang was missing its bang
- If installation of the same kernel is installed more than once (e.g. reinstallation), `dpkg-statoverride` (and the whole kernel installation) would exit with error, complaining about an override already existing [2].

Fixed with these changes respectively:
- Renamed script to remove the period
- Fixed typo in shebang
- Added `--force` flag to `dpkg-statoverride`

[0] https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/linux/+bug/759725
[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/debianutils/+bug/38022
[2] https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-manuals/+bug/1275080

Change-Id: I0e130e3c3ecf2171dbdc0e9a809f8066c30d4bc9
Closes-Bug: 1763479
"}]
commit_message:
Fix kernel post-installation script

`/etc/kernel/postinst.d/nova-kernel-permissions.sh` (introduced to fix Bug #1507915) is supposed to make newly installed kernels readable to the nova user, as kernels on an Ubuntu system are otherwise only readable to the root user [0].

This script didn't work for a few reasons:

- It never ran, because scripts in `/etc/kernel/postinst.d` are called by `run-parts`, and run-parts skips any script with a period in the name [1].
- Its shebang was missing its bang
- If installation of the same kernel is installed more than once (e.g. reinstallation), `dpkg-statoverride` (and the whole kernel installation) would exit with error, complaining about an override already existing [2].

Fixed with these changes respectively:
- Renamed script to remove the period
- Fixed typo in shebang
- Added `--force` flag to `dpkg-statoverride`

[0] https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/linux/+bug/759725
[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/debianutils/+bug/38022
[2] https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-manuals/+bug/1275080

Change-Id: I0e130e3c3ecf2171dbdc0e9a809f8066c30d4bc9
Closes-Bug: 1763479

commit_message:
Fix Alarm Details section in Alarm History view

The change adds dimension key/value pairs to the list of associated
metrics in Alarm Details section of Alarm History view. Without this
list the output is incomplete and confusing.

Story: 2001804
Task: 12529

commit_message:
Add heat dashboard into packages

This makes sures the heat dashboard is properly scoped to
the horizon group, this makes sure it's only cloned if
horizon is deployed.

Backport note:
This is included in https://review.openstack.org/558082
for the master branch.

Change-Id: I150c8ab52f635de77d8f827dc0426d4ef201e055

add "dependency management" section to the guide

Import a bunch of the content from the
openstack/requirements/README.rst file and put it here in the PTG
where it is more discoverable.

longer be set.

commit_message:
Add identity v3 project tags client

This PS adds ``project_tags_client`` to the identity v3
library. This feature enables the possibility of invoking
the following API actions:

    * update_project_tag
    * list_project_tags
    * update_all_project_tags
    * check_project_tag_existence
    * delete_project_tag
    * delete_all_project_tags

Change-Id: Iad6b3a88639bb4a0dc3aea5af2ba0162dfa19f96
Depends-On: Iec6b34c10ea1bd7103720c773b48ce130643115d

commit_message:
Allow reassociate for associated FIPs

The Compute -> Access & Security -> Floating IPs tab should provide
the Associate button for FIPs that are already associated.
The nova CLI allows a user to associate an already associated FIP,
with the behavior being that the FIP is transferred from one VM to another.

A single API call to nova associates the IP with the new VM and
disassociates it from the old VM. The CLI behavior is especially
useful for service IP's, where switching an IP from one VM to
another quickly is important.

Change-Id: Idcb6f1136171611d1d64d04341fb557dae5b8c10
Closes-Bug: #1518134

commit_message:
Eliminate possible insecure usage of temp file/directory.

This patch is a fix for the issue B108: hardcoded_tmp_directory
found by bandit scanner.

The main reasoning for that is the need for safely creating
a temporary file or directory.

Change-Id: I7956c4694734a4d5592eb12732c60d6ea5beccb4
Related-Bug: #1759250

commit_message:
Add project_tags identity feature flag

This PS adds the project_tags identity feature flag which allows
identity v3 project tags API functionality to be enabled for
releases after Pike. Once Pike is no longer supported in Tempest
this feature flag can be removed.

This feature was implemented in Queens [0].

[0] https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/keystone/queens.html

Depends-On: Ibaec1df79c9ac69c65cf5075c3519092bc609546
Change-Id: Iec6b34c10ea1bd7103720c773b48ce130643115d
(cherry picked from commit 1ab9a2d144ee1229cdd52c0a074931c719bc7ba0)

'}, {'account_id': 1501, 'date': '2014-03-28 16:50:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: (1 inline comment)

Overall I Think I like this ,but I do have a minor concern that a user that now tries to explicitly assign to the "default" SecGroup to an instance on a network where port security is disabled won't be warned that request has been silently ignored.

I'm wondering if we shouldn't find  way to distinguish between a user asking for "default" and the system filling in "default", or allow a user to say "--security-group=None" to show that they really understand this

The -1 is for the lack of a DocImpact in the commit, since I think this change in behaviour has to be at least described
somewhere.    I'm open to persuasion on the other issue

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-03 00:04:54.000000000', 'message': 'Fix port_security_enabled neutron extension

Neutron provides an extension called port_security which allows you to
specify if you want ports on a network to by default have
port_security_enabled (true/false). When a network is set to
port_security_enabled=False ports created on that network will by default
have no port_security (and no security groups). Previously if a network was
set to port_security_enabled=False nova-compute would raise an exception
that the security group could not be applied. This is because nova-api
automatically adds the default security group to the request.

This patch addresses this issue by removing the security groups from
the request if the network is marked as port_security_enabled=False.

Change-Id: Ifbcafd11f016a6d8c5b5079c9fdc27279cdd9bb3
Related-bug: # 1175464
'}, {'created': '2013-12-03 00:06:15.000000000', 'message': 'Fix port_security_enabled neutron extension

Neutron provides an extension called port_security which allows you to

port_security_enabled=False ports created on that network will by default

"}, {'created': '2014-03-15 02:28:32.000000000', 'message': "Fix port_security_enabled neutron extension

Neutron provides an extension called port_security which allows you to
specify if you want ports on a network to by default have
port_security_enabled (true/false). When a network is set to
port_security_enabled=False ports created on that network will by default
have no port_security (and no security groups). Previously if a network was
set to port_security_enabled=False nova-compute would raise an exception
that the security group could not be applied. This is because nova-api

the request if the network is marked as port_security_enabled=False and

"}, {'created': '2014-03-20 03:34:58.000000000', 'message': "Fix port_security_enabled neutron extension

Neutron provides an extension called port_security which allows you to
specify if you want ports on a network to by default have
port_security_enabled (true/false). When a network is set to
port_security_enabled=False ports created on that network will by default
have no port_security (and no security groups). Previously if a network was
set to port_security_enabled=False nova-compute would raise an exception
that the security group could not be applied. This is because nova-api
automatically adds the default security group to the request.

This patch addresses this issue by removing the security groups from
the request if the network is marked as port_security_enabled=False and
the security_group is the 'default' security group.

Change-Id: Ifbcafd11f016a6d8c5b5079c9fdc27279cdd9bb3
Related-bug: #1175464

launching instances on networks without subnets (which some plugins
allow).

commit_message:
Fix port_security_enabled neutron extension

Neutron provides an extension called port_security which allows you to
specify if you want ports on a network to by default have
port_security_enabled (true/false). When a network is set to
port_security_enabled=False ports created on that network will by default
have no port_security (and no security groups).

Previously, if a network was set to port_security_enabled=False
nova-compute would raise an exception that the security group could not be
applied. This is because nova-api automatically adds the default
security group to the request.

This patch addresses this issue by removing the security groups from
the request if the network is marked as port_security_enabled=False and
the security_group is the 'default' security group.

NOTE: This patch also fixes a behavior change that was added unintentionally
here: 00fca51036ac377f083613c03a25c3e8e5b077db which prevents one from
launching instances on networks without subnets (which some plugins
allow).

DocImpact
Change-Id: Ifbcafd11f016a6d8c5b5079c9fdc27279cdd9bb3
Related-bug: #1175464

subject: support to recover default vlan when delete port
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 10239, 'name': 'Dmitry Tantsur', 'email': 'dtantsur@protonmail.com', 'username': 'dtantsur'}, {'_account_id': 10453, 'name': 'octopuszhang', 'email': 'zhangyf@rc.inesa.com', 'username': '1'}, {'_account_id': 11655, 'name': 'Julia Kreger', 'email': 'juliaashleykreger@gmail.com', 'username': 'jkreger', 'status': 'On the moon! With a jetpack!'}, {'_account_id': 14525, 'name': 'Vasyl Saienko', 'email': 'vsaienko@mirantis.com', 'username': 'vsaienko'}, {'_account_id': 14826, 'name': 'Mark Goddard', 'email': 'mark@stackhpc.com', 'username': 'mgoddard'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 25943, 'name': 'Zachary Ma', 'email': 'mazengxie@126.com', 'username': 'Zachary'}, {'_account_id': 27369, 'name': 'Wang Weijia', 'email': '330636097@qq.com', 'username': 'Ben'}]

[{'account_id': 25943, 'date': '2018-03-01 08:58:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10453, 'date': '2018-03-02 03:21:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

In my opinion, if the default vlan for huawei switch is set to 100, but the port is set to vlan 1 after 'undo vlan segmentation_id', I think it's a bug for huawei switch or there wrong usage or wrong configuration. After all, it should not be fixed in ngs. Please correct me if I missunderstand."}, {'account_id': 25943, 'date': '2018-03-02 06:17:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

you are wrong.this patch want to recover the default configration when you delete port.

Ok, if we take ovs such as example, the tap will recover trunk mode when delete baremetal port. But my enrivoment maybe use vlan 100 to isolate the network，then what will you do?'}, {'account_id': 25943, 'date': '2018-03-02 06:21:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

And I want to use ironic-inspect to dynamic enroll. inronic-inspect network and provision network is Isolated.

So, it is necessary to revover a vlan that admin can specify for ironic inronic inspect， etc.'}, {'account_id': 10453, 'date': '2018-03-02 07:05:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

For the situation you described, I think it's better to add a inspector_network/default_network property to ironic_inspector/ironic_conductor, let ironic_inspector/ironic_conductor call neutron to switch port to specified vlan. Add a default vlan as a switch property in ngs is strange. Also, As far as I know, node inspection is done before node provided to nova instance, but delete_port in ngs is called after nova instances created with the node."}, {'account_id': 25943, 'date': '2018-03-02 07:26:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

yes，I think it is a good suggestion and I will rethink.

"node inspection is done before node provided to nova instance" is right, but the node will be reenroll sometimes, for example, modify the wire between the node and switch. So, node inspection will execute again.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-03-02 10:36:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(6 comments)

I saw the conversation after making my comments, but I'll submit them anyway."}, {'account_id': 25943, 'date': '2018-03-05 09:36:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

@octopuszhang: This is no way to add a inspector_network/default_network 
and let ironic_inspector/ironic_conductor call neutron to switch port 
to specified vlan.

Because ironic_inspector/ironic_conductor does not know the connection 
between baremetal node and switch.

How could networking_generic_switch know what interface of switch to 
set ?'}, {'account_id': 10453, 'date': '2018-03-05 09:48:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Ironic knows the connection between baremetal node and switch , which are stored in ironic node port info. That's how ironic can switch baremetal port in diffrent vlan when ironic deploy and clean node."}, {'account_id': 25943, 'date': '2018-03-05 09:50:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 25943, 'date': '2018-03-05 09:52:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 25943, 'date': '2018-03-05 09:59:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(5 comments)'}, {'account_id': 25943, 'date': '2018-03-05 10:50:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

@octopuszhang who tell the ironic ? Are you say the local_link_information? 
The local_link_infomation can be fixed by cmd or ironic-inspect.
What if I just want to get the  local_link_information by local_link_information ?'}, {'account_id': 25943, 'date': '2018-03-06 01:20:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 25943, 'date': '2018-03-06 03:21:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-03-06 13:52:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
support to recover default vlan when delete port

It will execute commands with deleting port, but it maybe different
from default configiration.
Most of switches will recover switch's interface to trunk mode,
but trunk mode maybe be expected to user. So we should support to
recover default vlan for other uses.

Change-Id: I4106eed8c40de988acb14be67f93303c7cdcbbd8
Closes-Bug: #1752480

commit_message:
Fix a capitalization mistake in README.rst

Reviewing the README.rst of tempest,
I noticed a wrong capitalization.
The word "Scenario" is capitalized when
instead it should be lower-case.
So I fix it.

Change-Id: I22208608e0b19df6da9d718e44499a1379ecd011

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-03 07:41:21.000000000', 'message': 'Fix TypeError in _unshelve_server

addOnException must accept exc_info, otherwise it will raise
"TypeError: _unshelve_server() takes no arguments (1 given)",
and because there exists check for server status before doing
unshelve_server in _unshelve_server, so we can safely use
addCleanup here, instead of addOnException.

Change-Id: I29759b4120dddd5e42b2ac431dc5884db4f694b5
Closes-Bug: #1741554
'}]
commit_message:
Fix TypeError in _unshelve_server

addOnException must accept exc_info, otherwise it will raise
"TypeError: _unshelve_server() takes no arguments (1 given)",
and because there exists check for server status before doing
unshelve_server in _unshelve_server, so we can safely use
addCleanup here, instead of addOnException.

Change-Id: I29759b4120dddd5e42b2ac431dc5884db4f694b5
Closes-Bug: #1741554

commit_message:
Switch to mkisofs for openSUSE distributions

In Tumbleweed genisoimage was dropped in favor of cdrtools,
so installing that no longer works. We can however install
mkisofs directly and switch to that as that is also available
in Leap 42.3 and Leap 15.0+ family distros.

Also drop dependency on libmysqlclient-devel which appears
unnecessary (and is no longer available with mariadb 10.2+)

Change-Id: Ie8402204b6cdf94c21865caba116d3fd1298c5ad

commit_message:
Start OVS as root on Tumblweed to workaround bsc#1085971

There is currently a OVS 2.9.0 update in Tumbleweed that
fails to start as it is having a race with systemd on creating
the home directory. Workaround is to run it as root for now.

Change-Id: Ief610c6473834b02a1d644d8f50d11138a48e6e6
